results.description:
We are a group of good guys and gals ! This group is intended for guys or girls that have a DUCATI bike or bikes that they actually ride. I will approve each member that joins this closed group and if you don't currently own a DUCATI, please go buy one and comeback. 


In addition, every member will be rated by one of the group's organizers and assessed either an A, B or C RIDER, as detailed below: * A-RIDER: Someone who is comfortable on his/her two wheel machine. Is able to keep up at a spirited pace if conditions allow. An A-RIDER is expected to receive NO guidance and/or direction on any given group ride and is expected to know all safety rules and formations. Group leader will NOT sit and wait for an A-RIDER. * B-RIDER: Someone who can ride and "for the most part" is comfortable on his/her two wheel machine. A B-RIDER is expected to receive a minimal level of guidance and/or direction on any given group ride and is expected to know all safety rules and formations. Group leader WILL wait for a B-RIDER. * C-RIDER: Someone who is in the process or beginning stages of getting comfortable with his/her two wheel machine. A C-RIDER is to receive all needed guidance and/or direction on any given group ride and is expected to be a great listener and adhere to safety rules and directions. Group leader WILL wait for an C-RIDER for as long as is needed.
results.name: EAST COAST DUCS

results.description:
This group was created to have fun with fellow bike enthusiasts in the best cycling city in the world (that's New York), to bring together those who use their bike for work, messengers and others, with regular bikers like me. And to be ambassadors for cycling in general. 

The emphasis will be on the journey, fun, communication and community building, not speed or final destination. The only rule for participation is to ride proudly and with the intention of making cycling attractive to others. We respect ourselves and everyone we meet along the way, be it other cyclists, pedestrians, dogs, cars, buses (even renovation trucks...). Acrobatics and improvisation are encouraged while risky behavior - especially behavior that puts others at risk - is frowned at. And of course: participation in this group is on your own responsibility and the organizer(s) have no responsibility for any damage or injury to you or your bike resulting from participating in this group. 

Runar/Organizer

results.description:
Have you been wanting to learn how to meditate? Or maybe you're an experienced meditater and are looking for a group of like-minded seekers to meditate with? Join us every Monday as we dive into the deeper teachings, then sit together for 45 minutes utilizing a myriad of meditation techniques that you can then utilize at home. No experience necessary! We offer a supportive community of new and experienced meditaters with the intention of diving deeper into the practice. Meditation is a journey of self-discovery. By making the mind calm and quiet, we can go deep within and discover who we really are. By doing so, we find lasting peace and happiness and learn how to effectively solve our life-problems and realize our highest aspirations.

All meditations are meant to purify our heart and bring our mind to its natural condition. Our consciousness is inherently pure, eternal, full of knowledge and bliss. But somehow or other it has been covered by and adulterated by so many misconceptions, so many desires, so many longings, so many anxieties about what we want and what we don’t want. 

When you look into a mirror, you see yourself. But what if that mirror has been neglected for hundreds of years? There are layers and layers of debris, dust, dirt and filth. And when you look into that mirror, all you see is the dust and the dirt that is accumulated, and all that you think is “This is me!” But when you clean the mirror, little by little you start seeing the image of yourself. And when the mirror is actually clean, you see who you are. Meditation is for that purpose; prayers are for that purpose; spirituality is for that purpose: to cleanse our heart, to cleanse our life-style so that we can actually directly experience our own essence, which is eternal, full of knowledge and full of love
results.name: Meditation & Kirtan: For New and Experienced - LES/E.Village

All ages and skill levels are welcome to connect with a community of artists and non-artists a like! I started this in 2012 with the original goal being to create a google street view map that 'skins' our digital perception of our communities with hand-drawn/illustrated versions of more human perceptions of the world around us. This is an annual outdoor event that is beginning in Nyack and will soon be traveling through our area regionally with a hope to expand nationally and then globally. 

As a Meetup group called 'Flash Mobbers' we will gather regularly pre and post  event dates to help facilitate, develop, expand and execute both the educational reach and interactive potential of the  Flash Sketch Mob events as they grow in quantity and geographical scope. 

You must be 18 years of age to become a Flash Sketch Mobber on Meetup.  However, Flash Sketch Mob events are annual 'family-friendly events'  in which you can register your children through billbatsonarts.com. Children under 18, who learn about Flash Sketch Mob through Meetup must be accompanied by a parent or guardian.

results.description:
The Network for Women in Business was founded by Toni Coleman Brown in the Fall of 2011 and launched in January 2012 with a three-fold mission to train, connect and advance women in business. Our slogan is simple and it fits with our mission: "We Educate to Elevate Women in Business." We believe that TRAINING is the key to success for most women in business. However, most entrepreneurs do not take the time out to get the training that they need to take their businesses to the next level. The Network for Women in Business help business owners by providing them with the most up-to-date and cutting-edge training in all aspects and areas of business. It doesn't matter if you're a solo-preneur or an entrepreneur running a multi-million dollar company with hundreds of employees or a home-based business owner, we have something for you. 

We are gearing up to be the premiere site for training women in business in all aspects of business from getting started, writing business plans, to developing a social media strategy or PR strategy. Within no time at all, the Network for Women in Business site will be filled with an archive of training unlike any other. It will be the place you come back to over and over again, not only for the training but also for the CONNECTIONS that you will be able to make with our members. When we launched our Facebook page on December 15, 2011, we had no idea that by the 28th of the same month that we would have over 2,000 Fans! Our official launch is slated for the 15th of January 2012. By the time that date comes, we anticipate that we will be very close to having 5,000 Facebook Fans, which should easily translate into a very active membership base. 

Premium membership allows our members and their businesses to be highlighted in our member directory for the world to see. This will allow members to connect with the right people to help them grow. Members will be able to ADVANCE their businesses. By being a member of the Network of Women in Business you will be able to increase your production and sales as a direct result of taking advantage of our training. You will be able to see a measurable difference in your bottom line. You will be able to say..."Before I was on the Network my business was _____ and after joining the Network my business has increased by ____as a result of being on the Network."

Never before has there existed an online space like the Network for Women in Business.
results.name: NYC Small Biz Boot Camp for Women

The main goal is to get more startups using open source, understand why they use it and the advantages for using it.

Our events average 20-30 members per event.  Our motto is, "why dine alone, when you can dine with new friends".  To see more of our events, you can visit, www.thesinglegourmet.net   We also have a 45+ dinner group on meetup as well. Most of the members that attend our dinners will be from The Single Gourmet.

We want to bring the adventure of the jungle to NYC and get a group together to do fun, challenging, and badass workouts outside! We will be organizing these workouts in Central Park (mostly on the Great Lawn or a near by open space) which will be free. results.description:
Are you totally psyched to dance?  We are too.  We're especially psyched to dance in a beautiful space to a really eclectic but integrated mix of music, without shoes, and without any drinking or drugs to get in the way of the real fun.  You'll find a range of ages, and a friendly environment where you can dance in your own space, or interact playfully with others.  It's a truly fun dance party!

The Barefoot Boogie is a freestyle dance which happens twice a month in New York City, on the second and fourth Saturdays of every month. If you've enjoyed any kind of conscious dance, ecstatic dance, 5 Rhythms, JourneyDance, contact improv, or any other kind of freeform dance, you'll enjoy the Boogie too. ( And if you've never been to any of these things but just love to move and dance, you'll probably love the Boogie too!) Come alone or bring your friends. 

At every Boogie you'll hear a wide variety of music: R&B, funk, tribal groove, ambient, world beat, electronica, disco, dub-step, swing-hop, you name it. The Barefoot Boogie is held at the New York Insight Meditation Center, at 28 West 27th Street, 10th Floor (Buzzer #27). 

Admission is a sliding scale from $10 to $15. (If this cost is too much for you, please consider volunteering! Door shift volunteers will receive $5 off for one door shift and a free dance for 2 door shifts.) Kids are welcome, and 12 and under are free.  However, all children must be accompanied by an adult.  

See www.barefootboogie.org for more info.
results.name: The Barefoot Boogie

results.description:
Just Breathe Yoga is a program designed for all levels, beginners, the curious and communities. It provides a safe place to come together and practice the beautiful tradition of yoga. We use no gimmicks, follow no fads or alter the power of the Vinyasa style. Vinyasa means to flow and as we flow we focus on breath, proper alignment of the body (yes we do adjustments!), movement and the simple practice of unfettered yoga. Classes are taught by registered / certified teachers in our community studio located within the Trinity Presbyterian Church in Paramus, NJ.

Just Breathe is not a religious program but does incorporate the importance of mindfulness, breath work and a positive outlook on life. People are our focus and today so many people are caretakers of aging or disable loved ones, working impossible hours and trying to meet the challenges of everyday life. It is easy to become “unfit” as we struggle to fit into a frantic world. Yoga allows each one of us time to pause, breathe, and stretch as we come together.
results.name: Paramus  - Just Breathe Yoga

results.description: This group is being formed to spread the word about Angelic Reiki in those parts of the United States in which it hasn't yet taken root fully. This wonderful, powerful healing modality is practiced by a fairly decent number of healers in the U.S., but it seems not yet strongly represented on the East Coast. We, the organizers (Sharon and Louisa) are very passionate about Angelic Reiki and feel that Spirit is pushing us to spread the word, so that in a few years' time, Angelic Reiki will be well known to the metaphysical community. We especially want to reach out to those practicing other forms of energy healing and assure these healers that whatever form of healing you're already doing, that healing and Angelic Reiki are not mutually exclusive. So, for example, If you are a healer and practice Usui Reiki, you SHOULD learn Angelic Reiki so that you can add it to your arsenal. This is not about a competition!!! This is about spreading more Angelic love and influence.
results.name: Angelic Reiki Healing Meetup

results.description: New York City is the birthplace of modern Theosophy, begun officially on November 17, 1875 by H. P. Blavatsky, William Q. Judge and Colonel Henry S. Olcott. Theosophy Hall NYC is the home of The United Lodge of Theosophists, an association of students independently devoted to the cause of Theosophy, and unattached to any Theosophical organization. ULT Meetings are free and open to all without distinction of race, creed, gender, condition or organization. Weekly classes in The Secret Doctrine are offered plus other classes featuring original teachings of Theosophy recorded in the writings of H.P. Blavatsky and William Q. Judge. We are a lively exchange place where ancient Wisdom Teachings are studied in the context of modern day conversation. Students explore the fundamental concepts and core ideas in religion, science and philosophy, then and now, and are encouraged to bring and ask questions. Our friendly dialogues are open to students young and old, new to Theosophy, just beginning, or returning for more. Please check the meetup schedule for free classes offered on Sunday mornings, Sunday nights, Monday and Wednesday nights. For more Theosophy pure and simple, check out the Monday class blog, at www.theosophywatch.com, on Facebook.com/theosophywatch, and Twitter @theosophywatch.
results.name: Theosophy Hall

results.description:
The Westchester Cycle Club: We are recreational bicyclists who ride in Westchester, Putnam and sometimes Rockland and Dutchess counties in New York State, north of New York City. Most of our members are from New York City, Westchester and Putnam. We have all types of rides, sometimes even on dirt. The club has a ride catagory system: A to D for road rides plus M for mountain bike rides. We try to schedule a ride at every level every Saturday and Sunday, sometimes more than one as long as the start locations are far apart. We also often schedule rides during the week. For anyone new to the club or thinking about joining, we offer O (orientation) rides. During the season, we also have casual rides - flings, we call them - that start and end at the same location every Wednesday and Friday. On special occasions, we have multi-level rides that end with a catered group lunch.

There is a $30 annual membership fee.  Members get: Access to MyWCC, Ride reminders, Monthly Newsletter, Access to our Cue Sheet Library, Discounts at local bike shops.

We are a non-profit. 

For more information, check out our website:

http://www.westchestercycleclub.org/
results.name: Westchester Cycling Club - Cycling Meetup

results.description:
Converting AWARENESS into ACTION is the critical-step in creating transformative social change. Join us on a JOURNEY TOWARDS MASTERY over the factors that determine how much impact your organization will ultimately create.

Conversion Chasm is a SOCIAL MOVEMENT designed to inspire a collaborative conversation that will accelerate the pace of social change around the world.

THINGS YOU'LL WANT TO KNOW:

• There’s a MANIFESTO: get our Saving The World Manifesto, adopt it, share it — and transform how social change organizations approach making action happen.

• There’s a BLOG: it’s called Conversion Chasm and on it we have begun to comprehensively explore the topic of converting Awareness-into-Action.

• There’s a METHODOLOGY: we have developed a unique Three-Step Conversion Methodology which makes maximizing conversion-to-action a straight-forward, practical endeavor across every type of social change enterprise.

• There's also LEAN SOCIAL: We apply our Conversion Methodology side-by-side with a toolkit of Lean Startup processes and techniques that we have specifically adapted for the social change context.

• We're helping members build ACTION-ORG's = social change organizations that have explicitly adopted a conversion-to-action focus.

This meet-up is about your journey towards mastery: what are the factors that drive (or inhibit) conversion-to-action — and what are other leaders and organizations already doing to make more action happen?

We invite you to join the conversation: to learn, to improve your understanding and your skills, and to share your own awareness-to-action journey with the world.

OUR MONTHLY MEETINGS WILL EMPHASIZE:

• The practical application our unique Conversion Methodology to specific organizational circumstances.

• Sessions with social change leaders who are committed to converting awareness into action.

• Group discussion and problem-solving of member challenges, opportunities, and experiences.

• Bring your toughest conversion challenges, obstacles, conundrums — and together, we will solve them.

WHO SHOULD JOIN:

• Social Change Leaders — founders, CEO’s, board members, executive directors, social entrepreneurs.

•  Active Change-Makers — members, donors, volunteers, and organizational staff members (including program, marketing, communications, and development personnel).

• Foundations, Philanthropists, Grant-Makers — funders shape the priorities and behaviors of the organizations they support. Join us and help guide social change organizations toward a comprehensive conversion-to-action focus.

Think of what all of us will learn together — and think of all the additional impact we'll create along the way.
results.name: Conversion Chasm NYC

results.description:
If for the Transhimanism reaching post-human stage through cognitive enhancement of the human body is a final goal, then for Cosmism it is just a beginning of our cosmic journey, starting on an “other side of the ocean” where our consciousness will be independent of its biological hardware. Cosmism is the best philosophical framework in which to conceptualize this journey.

The ancient Greeks believed that Cosmos (as universal order) are ruled by the Logos, which is the principle of reason, world-law and measure. They also believed that man is microcosm, structured similarly and connected to the Cosmos through Logos accordingly. Early Russian cosmists proposed the idea of technological decompaction/lightweighting of human body, which eventually wouldn’t need an atmosphere and will be powered directly by solar energy. They call it “radiant humanity” - perfect society of highly moral and super-conscious beings merging and colonizing the whole Universe.

Modern Cosmism brining to this doctrine ontological foundation, scientific structure and comprehension of possible technology. It's suggested that the profound nature of the reality is digital and it utilizes  existential source code coming from Being which are using “radiant humanity” for its preserving and modification.  Thus, we consider (for example) that Cosmological constant and precondition of Big Bang singularity were informationaly favorable mean guided.

Cosmism will “work closely together” with Transhumanism  on transition period until consciousness uploading  become possible. Then most likely humanity will be divided in two main directions: Earth base genetically improved biological civilization and departing digital society, creating new cosmic reality where the concepts of truth, consciousness, freedom and happiness will be deeply revised.
results.name: Cosmism Meetup

results.description:
With new sailing adventures on the horizon, Gotham Yacht Club is looking for new, fun sailors and non-sailors to join us on our boating day trips in 2015.

We like to fill the boat up with about 20-30 people. No sailing experience is required. The crew is made up of young, well-educated, and well-mannered Manhattan professionals. We are looking to meet new people who will enjoy the atmosphere and company of everyone on the boat.

Gotham Yacht Club takes trips around the Manhattan area in a 50-foot Beneteau. We usually sail the Hudson - the Statue of Liberty to the the George Washington Bridge - but also go to Martha's Vineyard, the Hamptons and the Jersey Shore.

If you and/or your friends are interested, please copy, paste, and fill out the questionnaire below in an email and send to nyharboryacht@yahoo.com. Please include your current email address so that we can contact you more easily.

EVERY APPLICANT (REVELERS, SUNBATHERS, ETC.)

Q) Please provide a link to your page on Facebook or other social networking site. Please attach a picture if you don’t have a page on a social networking site.

Q) How old are you?

Q) Where did you attend school?

Q) Will you please tell us a little bit about yourself?

FOR SAILOR APPLICANTS

Q) How many days, lifetime, have you crewed on, but not captained, a sailboat?

Q) How many days, lifetime, have you captained a sailboat?

Q) How many days, lifetime, have you crewed on but not captained, a non-sailboat?

Q) How many days, lifetime, have you captained, a non-sailboat?

Q) Will you tell us a little bit about your sailing experience?

Please copy and paste all questions and answers and send in an email to nyharboryacht@yahoo.com.

Thank You!
results.name: Gotham Yacht Club: Social Sail

results.description:
This is a group just for women interested in body positivity / body acceptance, activism, topfree equality and naturism!
Body acceptance is about accepting ourselves and others as they are. It's about recognizing all bodies as valid, good, and worthy of love and acceptance. It's about standing up against bullying, body shaming, and fat shaming. And of course we reject society's beauty standards telling us how we're supposed to look!
What is naturism? Naturism is the practice of going naked in a non-sexual environment, but for myself and many others, it's also based on a philosophy of acceptance and respect. Naturists believe the human body should be celebrated, and we reject the idea that the body is shameful, dirty or obscene. Naturism fosters positive body image and self-esteem, and has other social & psychological benefits. Naturists also live in harmony with nature and respect the environment.
With all the issues surrounding the female body, such as slut-shaming & victim-blaming, street harassment, sexual objectification, beauty standards, sexism and so on, women especially need safe spaces where we can reclaim our bodies, band together and support one another!
In this group, we will:
• Attend lectures & events related to body image / acceptance
• Engage in body positive activism
• Have clothing-optional and topfree (topless) social meetups
• Go on outdoor excursions like topfree hiking and skinny dipping
• And we're open to suggestions!
This group is open to women of all ages and trans women as well. LGBTQA+ friendly.

NEW MEMBERS: All new members must have a photo of themselves, and please take the time to answer the profile questions completely. Thank you.
results.name: Body Positive Nudies (Women Only)

This group is for entrepreneurs, business owners, startups, and anyone involved or interested in business. Starting and running a business enterprise is an exciting and rewarding experience. This group was created to educate entrepreneurs, answer any questions pertaining to the legal aspects of running a business, and provide fun and intimate networking opportunities for likeminded individuals.

What we have planned:

We host events that help people interested in business, from established entrepreneurs to startups, who are willing to reach the market, with their legal and professional needs while providing excellent, informal networking opportunities. This is the perfect chance for group members to overcome any hurdles and uncertainties with the support of a group with similar goals and concerns. This group will facilitate a safe space for members to network with other entrepreneurs, share useful resources and speak with a business attorney and other professionals free of charge to ensure that members are not missing anything vital for their businesses and are on the right track to a successful future.

results.description: We live in a time of great technological advancement. It is changing every aspect of our lives. We are innovating new technologies at a rapid pace and are changing ourselves as we adapt. The jobs we do are now different from the jobs that our Grandparents did, and the jobs our children will do will be different from the jobs we do today. The internet gives us unprecedented access to information. Computing put powerful tools in our pockets that allow us access to good information on a daily basis. Miniaturization opened up a new world of technical possibilities, and nanotechnology is opening even more. Biotechnology and computing are converging. We have mind-machine interfaces. Drones vacuum our floors and drop bombs in war zones. Lifestyle enhancing drugs and nutraceuticals are taken daily by people wanting to be smarter, healthier, stronger or faster. Automation is destroying jobs at a fantastic clip, while our policymakers are out of touch with the rapid changes. The sharing economy is altering the way we do business creating massive sales channels that enrich a few while spreading out access to labor that didn't exist before.
results.name: Pax Solaria

results.description:
Don't feel like you fit in with people around you? Do you feel like most people around you lack self-awareness and find trouble connecting with them? Do you feel like you have some higher level of consciousness than people around you? Do you feel like it can be both a blessing and a curse, leading to anxiety and depression? Have you been diagnosed with social anxiety? Depression? Asperger's? High-functioning autism? Bipolar Depression? Do you suspect or question whether you have any of these conditions? Please join me to try to figure out some of life's questions, to learn more about the world, each other, and ourselves. And maybe try to find our place in this world.

Note I hope we can study and discuss some philosophy and psychology to help us answer questions but this is not any sort of advanced philosophy discussion group. We are amateur philosophers (those who aren't interested in studying philosophy aren't expected to at all), though people with greater understanding of philosophy are welcome to help the rest of us understand things provided they respect the primary mission of this group. We are using the study of philosophy and psychology to answer our own questions.

This group is being organized on Staten Island, but if people from other boroughs or the metro area are interested and would prefer a meeting place in Manhattan or somewhere else, we can adapt to whoever joins.
results.name: Self-Awareness Exploration in NYC Area

results.description:
This is a group for sophisticated affluent individuals who are looking for upscale entertainment in NYC with like minded people. For those hard working refined gentlemen and elegant ladies who are looking to have a good time with an elite crowd. This is great for those busy entrepreneurs who find it difficult to maintain a social life or just want to socialize with people of similar class. This is especially great for individuals wishing to attend more black-tie events, but don't know where to start. People who are tired of the same lame nightclub parties and want something more high-class. 

We provide private and exclusive upscale events that cater to wealthy "high rollers" seeking lavish and extravagant entertainment. For those who can afford the affluent lifestyle, but may not necessarily have the social network or time to enjoy the luxuries that come with it. Our events include high end parties, galas, black tie events, masquerade balls, social gatherings, exclusive dinners, out of town trips, tasteful nightlife entertainment and more. 

I started this group as a way to bring together a group of elite individuals who could use some entertainment. I have an extensively large network of business vendors and celebrities that I would like to utilize. Many of them are NYC's top upscale nightclubs, five star restaurants, high end hotels, actors, musicians, models, dancers and more. I work in the film and television industry and a majority of my job includes working with many celebrities, businesses and city officials. 

As such, I have developed a great working relationship with many of the owners and corporate managers of these businesses, from the NYC mayor's office down to the smallest local mom and pop store. I would like to make use of my large network and also help hard working individuals enjoy quality entertainment. Don't worry, you'll get a say in these events. I'm open to any ideas that some of you high rollers might have. If you can think it up, I can most likely make it happen.


**PLEASE NOTE** 

Most event functions will require black-tie or semi formal attire. 

Proceeds from these events will go towards various select charities and non profit organizations.

results.description:
This group is for young professional women in NYC who would like to seriously learn about finance and how to make investments. So you should have no background in finance, and work in an unrelated field. Ideally there will only be a few people in the group. We will be going through a text book (so you'll have HW) and a friend of mine will be the "teacher," and come to all the group meetings and explain things that we did not understand. You dont need to pay for the tutoring (my friend just feels like "giving back"). However, it was recommended that we each have $1000 to invest, since we will be learning how to invest. We won't be doing any risky investments and you likely will not lose or make much money either. it is more about the learning process. 

NOTE: THIS GROUP IS FOR YOUNG PROFESSIONAL WOMEN (age 20s-30s) WHO ARE SERIOUS ABOUT LEARNING. It will NOT be a get together where we flirt with the idea about actually learning. Only smart and motivated women need apply. I only want a few people in this group, so I can't approve of everyone. So just try to make it clear that you really want to join/ are serious about learning/ are an intelligent human being. If you are fun and cool thats a plus!

:-)



you'll need to buy the book:http://www.amazon.com/Intelligent-Investor-...

The backstory of the creation of this group:

A few months go, I dated a guy who worked in finance. And we met up with some other friends, one of which  worked in finance as well. While sitting at a table at the bar I overheard the friend talking about his girlfriend saying "Girls just can't understand finance." Of course I chimed in and said WTF?! are you joking me?? OBVI if i had studied finance in college, then I would be sick at finance. 

Anyway, after this conversation, I realized that I would like to learn more about this predominantly male-driven field that our entire society is so dependent on. I would like at some point in my life be adequately educated on the stock market so that when I'm a "grown-up" I can make my own intelligent financial decisions. I'd like to converse with wall street peeps and be able to comprehend what it is that they do. But mostly, I am a person that loves to learn, and I would like to acquire some knowledge about this topic in which I am so pathetically ignorant about.
results.name: Girls Don't Understand Finance. EFF THAT. (NYC study group)

Main focus is to learn how to grow more beautiful plants using Mother Nature's best and there are opportunities to learn and grow from Master Gardener and Sprainbrook owner, Al Krautter. We will also celebrate with some pot-luck gatherings to share the bounty of our gardens. Sprouting, micro-greens and edible organics are a primary focus as well as conversion to organics as a social commitment to our future. Open to all kinds of related inquiry as well as opportunities to grow and intern in the Sprainbrook Greenhouses.

There is a spring fed swimming pool and the gardens on this 9+ acre site are flourishing in many ways.  Bring your dogs as we are pet friendly too (usual clean-up still required) and let them swim in the pool too.  See pictures in album for more view of Sprainbrook Nursery.

results.description:
THE NEIGHBORS

Improving Neighborhood Livelihood

****WE ARE GOING TO CLEAN UP NEW YORK CITY ON NEIGHBORHOOD AT A TIME****

We are your Neighbors. Among us are your family, friends, associates and colleagues. Together this community can provide a fellowship of inspiration and training. Inspiration to pursue the goals that your likeminded Neighbors can assist you obtain. As well as the training to do it. It's our belief if you are in the right Neighborhood or home you will do all that you are meant to do in the great City of New York. You will live out your destiny. With the guidance from your fellow Neighbors we will provide better quality of life for all of New York City. 

Founder
Phil Cappadora Jr.

“It’s a networking group I started for actors and artists alike. With this, we can host events and inform any members on what other members are doing. Like an open mic for charity. A walk to raise AWARENESS for a cause. Workshops to Prevent or Stop wrongful doings and lastly to Party among friends.  

* Our Mission is to improve each Neighborhoods Livelihood one block at a time. Through Theatre, Fundraisers, Mixers and Film we will focus our energies on the youth of our community and building strong families.

* What should you expect: Sanitary streets & sidewalks. Our Neighborhoods reflect traditions, culture, hospitality and values.

* Who should join: Parents, Uncles, Aunts, Grandparents and all Neighbors!  

* Why they should join: To cultivate New York City.

WE ARE LOCATED ON “MeetUp”

 Phil Cappadora Jr.

All sponsorship will be made available after the Screenings and Approval by founder Phil Cappadora. All sponsors and endorsements will be used to promote a company and its products. Services from THE NEIGHBORS will include online promotion and sanitation improvement for better customer service satisfaction!  
To Apply: PCAPPADORA@GMAIL.COM
Subject Line “NEIGHBOR (your name)”


~I know everywhere you go in the city the Neighborhood reflects the culture and traditions of that area. Right now my Neighborhood is unsanitary. And I want that to change. So I'm going to clean it up. And with the neighbors chipping in, we can spread this mode of hospitality through out the whole city. 

* Our Meetup Group is about the common good. Through Theatre, Fundraisers, Mixers and Film we will focus our energies on the youth of our community using after school programs and Summer Classes including; Acting, Movement, Voice & Speech, Puppetry and more. This group is also for the adults. From this Network you may find men and women who can develop a REEL or V/O disc to better market yourself, plus the word of mouth of all the Neighbors to Support you.

* Who should join: Anyone who has an idea but doesn't know how to develop it into reality. It can be a script idea. Also it can be a show. If you know of a charity that's lacking volunteers, the Neighbors will assist you spread the word. 

* Why they should join: To learn, share, and have fun.


* What members can expect: Expect us to be there when you need help. One of the primary functions of this organizations is to represent artists who have been working among union actors and are getting short changed. Say for example; its pouring rain on a set in Brooklyn and you ask to go inside to holding. When the P.A. says no then you need to hang out and wait, as it rains. BUT a Union Actor standing next to you gets "WET" pay. Others do not. And I don't think that's fair. Same goes for Meal Penalties. They are not applied to the NON Union workers and that also is not far. Also as a sole proprietor on set NON Union have no say in there rates/wages for work. That also is Unfair. 

Our Short Term goal as of now is not to UNIONIZE but to Stand United. Fair wages for fair work.
results.name: The Neighbors

results.description: In general terms Convergence of Cultures proposes to facilitate and stimulate dialogue between cultures, to oppose discrimination and violence based on active non-violence and non-discrimination to address these currents at their root, and to bring these proposals to all latitudes. In particular: a) To promote relationships between different cultures, "building bridges among people of all cultures". By means of organizing gatherings and ambits for interchange among people from different cultures. The intention of the interchange is not only to make their own cultures, concerns and aspirations known, but to allow a true dialogue oriented towards the search for common elements that are present in the hearts of different peoples and individuals. b) To denounce and struggle against all kinds of overt or covert discrimination Through different types of campaigns which allow the full expression of human rights; for the free circulation of human beings throughout the planet and for the possibility of everyone to choose the place and conditions in which they want to live; to improve the present and build a common future. c) To disseminate its ideas and activities Making contact with all the cultures in different countries, with the intention to disseminate and bring together people and organizations around the studies and activities of Convergence of Cultures.

results.description:
Our dragon boat crew came together in 1996, formed by a group of friends in New York City. Searching for an outlet for our irrepressible competitive spirit, we came together to test ourselves against the best in the competitions. Every spring through fall, we can be found spending our weekend mornings practicing in a never ending struggle to improve. But that doesn't mean we don't have fun! To be Xtreme means not only to work hard, but to play hard. Besides the weekly practices, there are also team events. There are meetings, dinners, outings and our annual team barbecue. It's because we combine the best of teamwork, competitiveness and fun that Xtreme NY has grown every year. Since 1996, we have grown from a handful of people to over 60 members. We are always happy to open our arms to anyone willing to make the commitment to our organization. And in return, that person doesn't just become a member of a team, that person becomes a part of the Xtreme NY family.

All are welcome to attend practices and try us out. After three practices, we will ask if you would like to become an official team member.

results.description:
Being a mother is hard enough. Keeping your family in order when you can barely keep yourself in order can be simply overwhelming. That's why there's the ADHD Mom's Group. Do you: Feel restless or on-edge and unable to relax? Push things off or have trouble finishing them? Struggle to get yourself or your kids out on time? Get distracted from things like monitoring your kids? Misunderstand or forget things you were supposed to do? If you answered "yes" to any of these questions, then you might have adult ADHD. But there's help! Join other local women just like you for a cognitive-behavioral group for moms with adult ADHD. You will learn practical, effective strategies together, in a positive, supportive environment. This 13-week research-based program, conducted by experienced clinical psychologist, Dr. Bin Goldman, targets essential skills, such as getting started on tasks, following through, time management, problem-solving, planning, organization, keeping track of things, and others. Meetings held at 451 West End Ave., Apt. 2E. Each group session is 2 hours long. Times based on members' preferences.

Please note, this is a fee- based group.
results.name: ADHD Moms Therapy Group

results.description:
Beautiful luxury hotel bars and lounges are both relaxing and stimulating. And they neither have to come with a pretentious attitude nor an outrageous price tag. This meetup group will have nothing to do with pretense, but will have everything to do with kindness, generosity of spirit, intellectual discussion, and exciting nights on the town.

Many of our favorite hotels are conveniently bunched between 55th and 60th streets, which makes for easy venue-hopping. The St. Regis, the Peninsula, the Parker Meridien, the Four Seasons, the Plaza, the Ritz-Carlton, the Mandarin Oriental. On the East Side are the Pierre, the Plaza Athenee, the Surrey and the Carlyle. We'll certainly hit up the "trendy" hotels as well, among them the Standards, the Gansevoorts, the W's, and the Dreams. And many more.

While we may have some of our parents' tastes, this is definitely NOT our parents' meetup. This group is oriented to those in their 20s, 30s and 40s (and a few beyond that if they can keep up).

We'll also sometimes go to cultural events and to hear live music. You may additionally find us on various types of boats. And whether it's on a hotel rooftop or in a lovely park, when good weather beckons us outside, we can't resist.

If somehow you got the impression that this is not a "party" meetup, think again. This is essentially a party meetup. Non-drinkers are welcome, but as a group we will often be drinking. Drinking, talking, having great conversations.

I said that this was essentially a party meetup, but that's not quite correct. We are essentially a group of very kind, thoughtful, down-to-earth and well-intentioned people, who are on the intellectual side and love to talk about ideas of all kinds. And love to have scintillating and delightful nights on the town while doing so. Is this you? Then you've found your home.

This is intended as a small meetup group, and we are planning to have relatively small events. We'll be starting with events for 10-12 people, and perhaps later allowing as many as 20 people at certain events. Most of all we are looking for a quality experience for everyone, not to have a large party with random strangers. Thank you.
results.name: Manhattan Luxury Hotel Bars, Lounges and Restaurants

results.description:
Just seeing if there are other musicians out there who like to compose film and game oriented music for hobby, ideally those just out of college like myself and have too much time on their hands. :P The reason for this group is that most other groups I've seen are more networking/career oriented, whereas I'm looking more for other musicians to collaborate and bounce ideas with.

The type of music for this group is less pop/techno/dance/house and more along the lines of stuff from film or video games, such as piano arrangements or orchestral pieces produced using sound libraries like EWQL or Vienna. Remixes and covers of existing songs are also welcome.  I don't really know the genre, but feel free to listen to samples below to get a feel for what I'm talking about.

Example of music this group will be aimed towards:  
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PJmlURZOKTI
http://www.newgrounds.com/audio/listen/395356
http://www.kotobox.net/ (my own work)

The idea for this group is to meet often and share current songs you are working on, as well as get feedback and collaborate with others. We can do improvisation sessions where we just play instruments together to brainstorm ideas for songs. Maybe we can even have days where we just spend hours composing as many songs as we can as a group. Feel free to suggest events or share ideas as well as your own projects in the discussion board.

results.description:
Leukemia & Lymphoma Society

The mission of The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society (LLS) is to cure leukemia, lymphoma, Hodgkin's disease and myeloma, and improve the quality of life of patients and their families.

LLS exists to find cures and ensure access to treatments for blood cancer patients. We are the voice for all blood cancer patients and we work to ensure access to treatments for all blood cancer patients.

Team In Training

Team In Training (TNT) is the flagship fundraising program for LLS and the only endurance sports training program for charity that raises money for blood cancer research. TNT and LLS are changing the landscape of blood cancer, not someday but today, making TNT the perfect way to fundraise.

Ambassadors for Cures

Team in Training’s Ambassadors for Cures is a new, flexible, and fun way for dedicated volunteers to support the Leukemia & Lymphoma Society's mission. Ambassadors are trained representatives in their own community who can create their own schedules based on how involved they would like to be.

Contact

For more information or to sign up today:

• Visit our website at http://www.teamintraining.org/nj/volunteer/

• Call or email Stephanie Sims at stephanie.sims@lls.org or 908.956.6620

• Complete our Volunteer Form at https://www.llsform.org/0350FS01/form6/index.html

GO TEAM!
results.name: Volunteer to Join the Fight Against Blood Cancer!

results.description:
BNI is a business and professional organization whose primary purpose is to exchange qualified, exclusive business referrals. In fact, since 1985, BNI members worldwide have exchanged over 15 Million business referrals, totaling over $8 Billion in new business.  In BNI, only one person per profession may join a local chapter.  And that means once you join us, you have completely locked out your competition.  However, if your competition joins first, the opportunity is gone. BNI is category exclusive, so once you join, you will not be competing with someone in the same profession for referrals.  If you consider networking and/or referrals to be an important part of new business development for your business, BNI represents a high-value opportunity for you.

As a reminder here's why we wake up early Wednesday mornings. 98% of businesses rely on referrals to build new business. ONLY 3% of businesses have a strategy to generate those referrals. Our BNI networking meetings are a proven word of mouth marketing referral generating strategy. Networking requires commitment. The most successful chapters of BNI are comprised of participants who are sincerely committed to helping one another through networking. They are a team. As a participant in BNI, you are responsible for complying with the policies and guidelines of the organization.
results.name: BNI Chapter 61

####

results.description:
If you are interested in losing weight with a group, this Meetup might be right for you.

I have always struggled with my weight. I've tried Weight Watchers (I made lifetime at age 22 - haven't seen that weight since!), South Beach (NEVER AGAIN!), and gluten free (how I missed you pizza...)

How many of you have tried every diet out there without true success? Diets are temporary. Your lifestyle is more important !

Tell me about your journey and I will share mine in a small group setting. Let's chat about YOUR goals, YOUR lifestyle, and ways that I can help you gain that energy back. I don't promise a miracle - and all results are individual. What I can tell you is that my friend Christina and Advocare saved my life; I want to pay it forward. Come and join in on a 24 Day Challenge - just 24 Days to a new you! 

Here is my before photo....

And the after.

When you join, I'll also invite you to the Private 24 Day Challenge Support Facebook page that has great ideas and recipes for your journey. Visit www.24daychallengemovie.com and my website.

I took my first challenge seriously and lost 15 pounds and 14 inches all around. I just am completing my second (early September 2015...stay tuned.)  I feel so much better! More energy, focus, clear skin, healthy hair, and I never feel hungry. My total cholesterol dropped 23% over the past three months - the bad dropped almost 30%. Sugar levels dropped too! 

A real story -- my friend Mike has been complaining of soreness and lack of energy. He gained over 100 pounds in the past 10 years. He started his first challenge in August. He lost over 15 pounds in 10 days. His goal is lose that weight by next year and complete a half-marathon with me. He has two children and wants to live for them. My friend Dee has three children and works multiple jobs, which means long hours. She wants to have better focus and energy to keep up with her day-to-day schedule. She lost 11 pounds in her first 24 Day Challenge.

I would love for you to join me and when we have a few people, I will reach out to you for the meetup at a Starbucks or even at the park (like Scalzi or even the beach if you want.) Thank you so much for your time!! Please feel free to email me, Tina, at weightloss4u@gmail.com.
results.name: Stamford 24 Day Weight Loss Challenge

results.description:
Picture this.... You are sitting at home watching tv and your favorite singing show is on... As you are drinking your alcoholic beverage you say to yourself "hey I can do better then that guy".... You pick up your cell phone and open up meetup, scroll through groups and stop... You finally found it! A group of people that think the exact same thing! Welcome to Bay Ridge Karaoke! Who?

My name is Tommy and I love to sing! I have been doing karaoke for years and try to find the best places to go... I'm not talking about handing the mic over and singing... No no no I'm talking about getting everyone involved and making it a time you will never forget!

Where?

Meetings happen mainly in the area of Bay Ridge... But that doesn't mean only Bay Ridge residents can join... That would be neighborhood-ist Why?


Why the hell not! You want to meet others who love to sing? Want to show off your talents (or lack of)? Do you just not care about making a fool of yourself for the benefit of the crowd? Then join us in the awesome that is Bay Ridge Karaoke!

Final thoughts:

At the end of the day it's simple... We are a fun loving group of singers who like to hit the high notes along with slamming some beers down...So if you love to sing and have a good time, this is the group you want to join!

Crochet, sewing, jewelry making, soap making, every kind of DIY...you name it we make it! We're bringing back the lost art of making in an awesome way. MAKE art lab was founded by DIY expert Crystal Sharpe-Hampton. I am a craft professional who saw a need for fun, approachable crafts activities for creative (but busy) people. I took my knowledge of the crafts industry, combined it with the NYC DIY scene, added in delicious food, great style, and good music–and Make art lab was born. I'm just ecstatic MAKE art lab is a bright, cheerful, airy creative space that offers a full schedule of modern craft and DIY classes. I'm just ecstatic to about this Meet Up. Hope to see you there!

results.description:
#ODSC brings together the open source and data science communities with the goal of helping its members learn, connect and grow.

The focus of this Meetup group is to allow #ODSC to work with Meetup groups, non-profits, and other organizations to present informative lectures, workshops, code sprints and networking events to help grow the use of open source languages and tools within the data science and data-centric community. As such, our specific goals are:


1. Build a collaborative group to work with other Meetup groups, non-profits, and other organizations.

2. Promote the use of open source languages and tools amongst data scientists and others.

3. Host educational workshops.

4. Spread awareness of new open source languages and tools that can be used in data science.

5. Contribute back to the open source community.


Who is this meetup for?

• Data engineers, analysts, scientists, and other practitioners

• R, Python and other software engineers who work with data or want to learn

• Data visualization developers and designers

• Non-technical team leads, executives, and other decision makers from data centric startups and large companies looking to utilize open source tools


How can you get involved?

• Attend events, network and precipitate!

• Give a talk or workshop that meets our goals

• Volunteer to help the group (social media, website, blogging)

• Provide us with a venue

• Sponsor food and drinks
results.name: New York Data Science #ODSC

results.description:
Do you want more out of your life?  Do you wish you had more time to do the things you love?  Are you lost and confused about your health and nutrition?  Do you wish someone would just take the time to listen to your concerns?  Do you get to the end of your day with an overwhelming exhaustion and wonder how others have the energy to go work out?  Do you wish you had more realistic tools to manage your stress?  Meet Jill Corrigan and make Women's Wellness Warriors a part of your journey to a healthier, empowered and vibrant lifestyle. 

What can Jill do for you?  She can provide a safe and non-judgmental space with a group of supportive and like-minded women for you to talk to about your health concerns, stressors, and whatever curveball life throws your way.  Together we can help you to take control of your health and life by providing you the tools to make informed choices on food and strategies for creating a healthy life balance.  Join us for workshops where we will discuss topics to arm you with the information you need to empower yourself to live the healthy life that you’ve envisioned for yourself.


Find out more about Jill at http://forthehealthofit.life
results.name: Women's Wellness Warriors

results.description:
Tired of Watching life go on around you?! Well I am. I know we are often overlooked so I started this community for Young adults 18 to 39 like myself living with Cancer or survivors, friends, family & supporters regardless of type and diagnosis. Activities held in Queens, LI, Brooklyn & nyc.

My goal is to bring together a diverse group of people who share a love for life to take part in fun & interesting activities & events involving nature (State park/ farm/ serenity), the outdoors , healthy lifestyles, Photography, socials, chats, walks in the park & maybe even some writing classes. 

Lower energy levels should not banish us to the geriatrics ward so we'll combine non-too-strenuous activities depending on ability level with fun!! No matter where you are in your journey there is no competition about who has what condition, just a positive & encouraging space for young adults, professionals & non-professionals alike. 

It is assumed that you've been cleared to or will be able to participate in activity. 

...So what are you waiting on? Let's get on with the business of life. We welcome everyone so get off your A$$ & join in & Invite Your friends Too! :) 

I will try to put together programming that we all enjoy but your suggestions are welcome as well. Pls be sure to Upload an actual photo.

Looking forward to meeting you! The nature of the meetup a will be personal so hopefully no one feels left out as happens on some other groups.

Learn How to Sync your Calendar to Google & Smartphone & never miss another event.

Our Website: VoicingItOUT.com (More ways to connect there)

Our Fb Page is: Voicing-It-OUT-The-Young-Adult-Cancer-Collective

TEA & THERAPY NIGHT

NYC CARIBBEAN FOOD FESTIVAL

results.description:
Girlfriends Pray (GP) Local is everywhere, for every woman, in every season of her life!  Once a month our Local Ambassadors host a Saturday morning meet-up in cities all around the world to discuss prayer, and connect with women in their local communities for fellowship, food, and fun on the strength of our faith.

It is the mission of Girlfriends Pray Ministries to get more women closer to God through prayer; and our vision is to get 1 million women around the world united in prayer. Although we are a non-traditional unconventional ministry with 80% of our service to women delivered virtually, in 2015 we expanded our service to women nationally and internationally off-line with our LIVE Breakfast Book Club (BBC) prayer groups. 

We encourage you to also partner with us as day after day we connect with women all around the global and come face-to-face with real life issues, challenges and the needs of women. So many women depend on Girlfriends Pray Ministries as a life line to God.  Every day we see lives changed, lives impacted and souls led back to Jesus Christ through our local meet-ups and our prayer line, (712) 775-7031 access code 943334#. 

Here's a testimony from one of our girlfriends, Courtney -- “For those of you just joining Girlfriends Pray, if it had not been for God and this prayer line on my side …. Where would I be … in the grave by my own hand!”

We thank you in advance for joining us and your financial gift as an offering for the ongoing support of Girlfriends Pray Ministries. To become a partner please CLICK HERE.

We look forward to meeting you face-to-face at our next monthly meet-up.

Girlfriends Pray Local Ambassador Leadership Team
Praying Without Ceasing.... 1 Thessalonians 5:17 Girlfriends Pray Ministries 
Prayer Line: (712) 775-7031 access code 943334#
Email: Local@GirlfriendsPray.org
Website: www.GirlfriendsPray.org
@GirlfriendsPray

(2) Stay focused through a guided meditation session 

(3) Start and maintain a regular meditation practice 

New York Meditation for Health Meetup welcomes everyone. The meetup is focused on helping individuals with their health and mental well-being, and is not geared toward any spiritual practice

results.description:
This Meetup is an extension of the website https://www.Stitch.net, and is run by Stitch.net’s team. This Meetup group provides adults 50+ with the opportunities to meet and mingle with others from the New York tri-state area during casual and extremely low-pressure events. Some events we have put on in the past are “Speed-Meeting” events, movie screenings, coffee get-togethers, and more. We welcome anyone 50 and older, who is looking for any type of companionship, to join, and strongly encourage future Meetup suggestions and ideas!

What is Stitch.net?
Stitch.net is an online service, which helps adults 50 years and over find the companionship they are looking for. For some people this might be a romantic partner, for others it could be just a friend who likes partaking in the same activities. Stitch recognizes that there are many different types of companionship, and that the need for companionship doesn’t go away as we get older. You can read more about Stitch.net on Stitch.net’s FAQ page here: https://www.stitch.net/FAQ

Please Note:
-Even though we highly recommend it, you will never be required or pressured to join Stitch.net’s online services, and will never be required to be on Stitch.net to attend an event going forward.

-Some of the RSVPs for our events will be done through a different website other than Meetup when we have to limit the number of attendees. Due to all of Stitch.net’s members not being on Meetup, we believe this is the most fair way to RSVP for these types of events. We will always post on the Meetup when this is the case.

Questions? Comments?
Email Michael at michaeldean@stitch.net
(415) 800-2918 x702

results.description:
NuDance is a nude dance movement; it may sound new to you, but we see it as urban movement going back to its roots ;-)
We see dance as a celebration of human body in motion, and what a better way to celebrate and appreciate it than in the nude? We also think that by removing clothes, we’ll get rid of preconceived notions of how we are supposed to move according to the social status and social group associated with clothes; also, different dance styles are usually associated with different attire, whereas we want to give your body full freedom in motion and let you move the way you want irrespective of style. In other words, free your ass, and your mind will follow!

The class is based on various street/urban dance styles, such as hip-hop, breaking, krump, house, etc. Electronic music and various mixes will serve as the musical accompaniment for the class, to get your energy flowing and your heart pumping while you have fun, learn and get a great workout in the process! And while these styles may appear utterly modern, many moves and rhythms are traced back to tribal and folk origins. Thus nudity will only add that authentic, raw feel, as in many tropical cultures, as well as the cradle of European civilization, Ancient Greece, dance was often performed naked.

And as a pleasant side effect, you’ll probably learn the moves better than at any other (clothed) class, because you can’t cheat your moves naked ;-)

Enjoy this preview with our brilliant instructor damoN, and stay tuned for updates! Join the NuDance Movement!

https://vimeo.com/129397780
results.name: NuDance

results.description:
What is Microservices Day?

Microservices Day is a conference by the enterprise, for the enterprise. It brings together people from organizations that have adopted (or are planning to adopt) a microservices approach to running their business and focuses on the issues that companies face. It gives participants a forum to discuss and share their experiences with microservices through advice, tips and tricks as well as driving forward both the technology and business community. Come join us at The Altman Building, 135 West 18th Street in New York on July 13th! The event will consist of a range of talks from industry leaders who have deep experience building and operating microservices systems at scale. Panel discussions and active audience participation will be a further part of the event, as the implications of enabling business to innovate at a faster pace than ever before will be a key discussion point. Come join the early adopters at the dawn of a new era in business computing!
results.name: Microservices Day NYC - July 13, 2015

results.description:
NYC Camp is NYC's largest annual open source developer conference.

This year NYC Camp (aka 'nice camp') will host 1,500+ attendees from over 15 countries a the United Nations from July 16-19. Our program  includes:

• Training Day  (Thu Jul 16)

• Summits & Mini Camps  Day (Fri Jul 17)

• Sessions  & Keynote Day (Sat Jul 18)

• Sessions & Sprints  Day (Sun Jul 19)

We also have code sprints running all week (Jul 13-19) and an open Source Angel Hack running on the weekend of Jul 18-19.

Our attendees  are primarily open source software developers, but also include a mix of technical strategists, decision makers, designers, trainers and project managers.

Our sessions  are focused on open source languages (PHP, Python, JS, etc.) and related open source frameworks/libraries (Angular, Ember, Backbone, Meteor, Django, Drupal, Symfony, D3, etc.). We also include sessions on the web platform use to help host these sites and apps created with thes open source tools (e.g., Acquia, AWS, Bluemix/IBM, Digital Ocean, Galaxy, Google Cloud, OpenShift, Pantheon, etc.).

We also have some civic hacking initiatives relating to youth and tech, women in tech, and Apps for Humanity/Coding for Causes. 

NYC Camp tickets are free , register to attend here: http://NYCCamp.org/register
results.name: NYC Camp Open Source Conference

We offer weekly improv classes appropriate for all levels, even those with zero experience. 

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 

-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level? 

Then this is the class for you!  In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing) and work through various exercises designed to help make your scene work more successful. You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

If these are elements you would look for, my class may be worth a try. Alternately, if you know of anyone who is looking for an affordable but satisfying improv experience - beginner or otherwise, please send them my way. Guaranteed satisfaction or your money back. 

Hope to see you there, 

Steve

topics.name: What is Happiness: What Makes Us Happy

results.description:
Hello, I'm Michele Phillips, the author of Happiness is a Habit - Simple Daily Rituals that Increase Energy, Improve Well-Being and Add Joy to Every Day. 

My goal is to create events that attract other positive and optimistic people who want to have some fun and focus on what is going right in their lives. I am organizing "Happy" Happy Hours and Inspirational Hikes with the goal of generating positive conversation. The world can be such a stressful and unbalanced place. The amount of bad news reported always outweighs the good. I know good news is out there and I know there is a higher energy that comes from positive versus negative conversations. So I hope you will join me at one of my events. I kick each event off with something inspirational and then we all share our good news. I know for a fact that we gain strength from each others strength, we gain wisdom from sharing our stories and we grow happier and more compassionate when we open our hearts to each other. 

I hope to see your smiling face at my next event. 

MAKE it a great day!

 Live Happy, Michele

results.description:
Sodalitas Rosae+Crucis & Solis Alati is a magical, mystical and alchemical Order, manifested in the fall of 2002 A.D., and publicly opened at the spring equinox 2003. Our intention is to bring together some of the main esoteric streams and movements within the western hermetic tradition, under the apophthegm of the Rosicrucian ideal, as stated in the Fama and Confessio: a brotherhood, working in secrecy, focused on a sincere inner development of its members, thereby affecting the world at large, without any interest of financial gain. The name, Sodalitas Rosae+Crucis & Solis Alati, is in fact the name of two Orders; the first, Sodalitas Rosae+Crucis (S.R.C.), translates into 'The Secret Society of the Rosy Cross', thus representing the Rosicrucian flavour of the magical and mystical processes that lead the candidate to a full contact with his/her Holy Guardian Angel. The second, Sodalitas Solis Alati (S.S.A.), which translates into "The Secret Society of the Winged Sun", indicates the alchemical work that the adept is then ready for. Within these two Orders, the magical work and initiations of the Golden Dawn, Alpha & Omega and Rosae Rubeae et Aurea Crucis, the mystical work and initiations of Christian Theurgy and the alchemical work of the Royal Path integrates into a coherent system of personal unfoldment and development, where every step follows the next in a clear and consistent way. The purpose of the Order is the perpetuation and realization of the western Hermetic tradition in this new era. Our work is to bring forth the Light of our predecessors, our Mothers and Fathers in Gnosis, Who have perpetuated Truth through the traditions of the Rosicrucian Order, the Primitive Rites of the Egyptians, the Royal Art of the Alchemists, The Concealed Mysteries of the Kabbalists & the Gnosis of our beloved Lady Sophia. We invite you to read through the information provided on this site, as well as to contact the New York Circle if you want further information.

www.rosae-crucis.net

In L.V.X. Sub Umbra Alarum Tuarum, Yeheshua.
results.name: Golden Dawn - Sodalitas Rosae+Crucis et Solis Alati - N.Y.

results.description:
What is Break Diving? It's a mindset.  It's the lost art of finding and creating opportunity. Instead of waiting for opportunities to float to the surface, break divers DIVE IN to the cold, icy, and treacherous shark-infested waters of resistance and find their 'chance of a lifetime' in the muddy bottom where no one else dares to tread.

WHAT THIS MEETUP GROUP IS ABOUT:
The purpose of this Meetup group is to inspire members to pursue their dreams and find solutions to problems encountered along the way.  Think of it as a gym membership for your life, offering engaging and inspiring meetups, seminars, and courses.  This Meetup might also be considered life and business coaching in a fun group environment.  Bottom line, studies have shown that we become the type of person we hang out with the most.  So, come network, learn from, and be inspired by other winners just like you!  .

WHO SHOULD JOIN:
If you have big dreams, great ambitions, and outlandish plans... JOIN US.
If you want help and encouragement figuring out how to get from Point A to Point B... JOIN US.
If you want to do fun things with other people with the same positive mindset as you... JOIN US.
If you think you are good at solving problems and offering solutions to others on this path called life... JOIN US.
If you want to be inspired and motivated to be more, do more, and live more... JOIN US.

WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN:
Life is tough.  It's even harder when you're trying to accomplish big goals.  And well, it's nearly impossible to accomplish those big goals entirely by yourself.  So... why not share your goals and dreams with other winners and get their feedback?  Why not encourage others with your unique perspective on their situations?  EVERYONE needs encouragement and 'outside the box' thinking.  This group can provide that encouragement and outside-the-box thinking.  More importantly, you can provide that same fresh positive outlook to other group members.  A rising tide raises all ships.  So come join this rising tide of awesome people doing awesome things!  Monroe Mann (Bio below, or Google him) and his fellow Break Divers will inspire you, encourage you, and force you to think in ways you never could have on your own.  The result: your life is going to get a whole lot better.

WHAT CAN YOU EXPECT AS A BREAK DIVING MEMBER: 
The basic framework of the group is meetings and get-togethers-->inspirationally focused and moderated by motivational dynamo Monroe Mann, who many have called The Tony Robbins of the Entertainment World.  Our meetings are ALWAYS inspiring; always hands-on and practical; always future focused (i.e. YOUR future); and sometimes have an adventure portion to them, i.e. a Citibike adventure in NYC that starts with a motivational pow-wow and finishes with an invigorating kick in the pants. 

The idea is that each Meetup will leave you encouraged and motivated, armed with solutions to whatever issues you are facing, and a battle plan for the next few weeks to tackle your goals and dreams.  More often than not, you'll also make new friendships and reinforce old ones.  

Bottom line: the focus of Break Diving is simple--to guide members to become our best by inspiring one another to overcome difficult challenges on the road to reaching our dreams.  In other words, this Meetup group's purpose is to help inspire you to DIVE into this crazy world and FIND YOUR BREAKS AND OPPORTUNITIES.  We want you to become... a Break Diver! 

Sound good? 

If so, come join our collective of winners!  If you are ready to grab life by the horns and finally do what you know you were meant to do, welcome to your new home, and welcome... to the first day of the rest of your life.  

MODERATED BY:

Monroe Mann, the founder of Break Diving, and a dude who epitomizes the philosophy of No Rules, No Excuses, No Regrets that he espouses. In his short life to date he has:

* written and published 8 self-help and business books, one of which is a Barnes & Noble # 1 bestseller
* served his country as an intelligence office in Iraq and was nominated for a bronze star
* produced and directed the now successful comedy horror film "You Can't Kill Stephen King" (available at Best Buy and Amazon Instant Video) and is listed on IMDb as an actor, writer, producer, director
* Lived in Europe for two years, China for one, and Iraq for one, and now speaks French, Italian, and Chinese--all at above conversational levels, and knows basic Arabic.
* Earned five advanced degrees: Juris Doctor, MBA, Masters in Entrepreneurship, Masters of Law in Commercial Real Estate, and is now completing his PhD dissertation in Psychology
* Earned his EMT, Lifeguard, and Wilderness EMT certifications and volunteered as such in Haiti after the earthquake
* Gone on a one-week dogsledding adventure, driven cross country from NYC to San Diego, traveled cross-country by Amtrak from Seattle to New York City, been to over 30 countries, won an ostrich riding competition in South Africa, dove with sharks in the Bahamas, played with falcons in Mongolia, performed on stage with New York City Opera, and the list goes on and on and on!
* Bottom line: he has given hundreds of motivational speeches to people and organizations around the world and helped change the lives of thousands, and he wants to help change yours for the better too!

Why does he want to run this meetup group?  Because his greatest joy in life is helping others to realize that "impossible" is just an excuse.  And when you get inspired, you will in turn be helping to inspire him.  Maybe most importantly, he likes making new friends with those who are also doing or trying to do great things with their lives.  It's a win, win, win!  So join, join, join!
results.name: Break Diving NYC - No Rules, No Excuses, No Regrets. (tm)

results.description:
Studying Spanish in a classroom environment for years and never have a significant conversation with a native speaker or never develop a friendship using Spanish as your main tool is analogous to train football or any other sports but refuse to play in a real game when given the opportunity.

This meetup is all about that very important aspect of language learning. We give our members the opportunity to immerse themselves in a Spanish environment for a couple of hours, to communicate in Spanish and also learn, all this while enjoying a good meal and making new amigos.

You are welcomed  to join us regardless of your perceived current level of Spanish. The most important factor will be your ability to keep your mind opened to new experiences, your enthusiasm and your lack of "shame" for making mistakes. We all learn from our mistakes, including the others who are listening. 

Of course we also welcome any native speaker at our table. You guys give the authenticity to everything we're doing.

We're looking forward to seeing everyone very soon.
results.name: The Long Island Spanish Club - Meetup

topics.name: Online Education & Technology For Educators and HR

results.description:
This is a group for local teachers and students who want to learn how to engage their students more effectively on mobile devices. Through these Meetups educators will learn how to transform students' mobile devices from a distraction into an asset for leaning. Utilizing the SchoolBuilder Studio platform educators will learn how to compose an app utilizing publicly available information such as RSS feeds, calendars, videos, images, podcasts, text, webpages and more. Educators may also utilize existingclassroom content (lesson plans, PowerPoints, year-long curriculum) in addition to curating original work. 


All of our Meetups will be FREE but will be limited in capacity and will be populated on a first-come-first-serve basis. During these Meetups educators will learn the necessary skills to build an app for their classroom utilizing their own content or by pulling content from our Content Library. Each attendee will leave with free access to their app and the SchoolBuilder Studio software in addition to a certificate of recognition stating that he/she is now a Gadget Guru who is certified to assist others with the platform.
results.name: Workshops: Educators Build Mobile Apps for the Classroom

results.description:
我们将定期在155D East broadway(Lower East Side)举办12-16人制的狼人杀游戏,

希望所有在纽约的华人杀人游戏或者狼人游戏的国人玩家多多参与关注.


游戏规则


胜利条件

平民方胜利条件:所有杀手死亡

杀手方胜利条件:杀手方人数大于场上剩余人数的一半

另有第三方角色胜利条件另述,


角色介绍

平民方:

普通平民:

女巫:整场游戏有一瓶解药,一瓶毒药.法官会在每天天黑询问是否使用,并会告知当晚被杀者.

铁匠:每天晚上必须给场上除自己外的人一把枪,法官会提示收到枪的人,此人可以在第二天白天公开开枪射杀一人,

或者在第二天投票环节前匿名杀人,也可以不杀.枪只本轮有效.

预言家:每晚验人,

米勒:搅屎棍

        自己拿到的是普通村民牌,

        如果被警察验到会被告知是杀手,

        如果被杀手杀死会翻牌为米勒,

        如果被投死则会翻牌会杀手.


杀手方

杀手:每晚杀人


第三方

白痴:如果被投死,并且在法官倒数5秒内大声喊出"我是白痴",则单独胜利.


游戏地址

155D East Broadway, New York.

（F线地铁,East Broadway下车即到)


收费

由于我们是租用场所,所以需要收取每人12元的场地费,现场会提供橙汁+水.
results.name: 纽约村之夜--华人狼人杀游戏群

results.description:
Founded in 1934, The New York Railroad Enthusiasts is a non-profit educational organization consisting of railfans from all walks of life. Members receive a copy of the BULLETIN monthly, with a combined issue for July and August.

Monthly meetings are held, usually on the fourth Friday of the month (no meetings in July and August), at the Williamson Library, Grand Central Terminal, New York City. Visual entertainment (slides or film) is introduced by a guest presenter. Meet at the entrance to Track 23 on the upper level at 7:00 PM or 7:15 PM to be escorted to the library, which is in a secured area. Late arrivals should phone the library at (516) 660-1972. A $5.00 admission fee is charged for non-members.

The membership application can be found at: http://www.nyrre.org/PDF/Mbshp_Applic.pdf

Our photo gallery can be found at http://www.nyrre.org/Gallery/

Our email is info@nyrre.org

We look forward to you climbing on board!
